title: Citi in Japan Launches Financial Life Skills and Money Management for Women
summary: Citi in Japan, in cooperation with the National Institute on Consumer Education ("NICE," President: Kazuko Takabu), will launch a new financial education program, "Financial Life Skills and Money Management for Women," beginning October 2011.
tag-1: Citi in Japan Launches Financial Life Skills and Money Management for Women
tag-3: Citi in Japan, in cooperation with the National Institute on Consumer Education ("NICE," President: Kazuko Takabu), will launch a new financial education program, "Financial Life Skills and Money Management for Women," beginning October 2011.
tag-4: The classes, part of the financial and economic education assistance Citi provides as a contribution to its communities worldwide, are targeted for members of regional women's organizations that are part of the National Federation of Regional Women's Organizations (NFRWO). This is the first time for Citi in Japan to implement a financial and economic education program specifically for mature and elderly women.
tag-5: Citi Foundation will provide a grant ($140,000 in fiscal 2011) to NICE, and through this partnership, a financial and economic education program will be planned and implemented to suit the needs of NFRWO members. For fiscal 2011, two basic classes will be held in Toyama prefecture and Niigata prefecture, with 50 participants each for a total of 100. The program will consist of a total of eight sessions, each approximately two-hours long. The goal is that after completing the program, [more than half of the] participants will be able to set up and manage a budget, regularly save money, and select appropriate financial instruments for loans and insurance.
tag-6: A survey to 4,000 mature and elderly members of the NFRWO is planned to help establish the curriculum, understand what their concerns are, and what they would like to learn about finance and the economy. Further, several informal sessions are planned during and after the program to strengthen the bonds among participants and offer occasions where they can review what they learned and talk about other concerns and issues in a relaxed atmosphere.
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
